content: Kerstin Bach - NTNU Kerstin Bach Download press photo Download press photo Foto: Close Kerstin Bach Professor Department of Computer Science Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering kerstin.bach@ntnu.no +4773597410 +4793032400 Gamle fysikk, 254, Gløshaugen Twitter ResearchGate Google Scholar https://kerstinbach.de/ About Kerstin is a professor at the Department of Computer Science. Her core competence field is Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. She is currently the director of the Norwegian Open AI Lab, research director of the NorwAI research center, and deputy head of the Data and Artificial Intelligence unit. Kerstin was awarded her PhD in Computer Science from the University of Hildesheim, Germany. Her main research interests are data-driven decision support systems as well as knowledge-intensive Case-Based Reasoning. She is active in the national and international AI community, chairing and reviewing for international conferences and serving on the board of the German Society for Computer Science's Special Interest Group on Knowledge Management and the Norwegian AI Society. She is a member of ACM, IEEE, and ELLIS. Research Interest: The main focus of her work is methods for applied artificial intelligence. While the application domains differ, we are investigating how to make knowledge and experience available through intelligent systems. Moreover, how to build systems that support complex, knowledge-intensive decisions using heterogeneous data sources. She has been managing AI research in several e-health research projects, including the management of low back pain, physical activity, and sleep, or mental health. She enjoys discussing AI methodologies and applications with fellow researchers, but more importantly, teaching it to students and bringing it into multidisciplinary projects, thereby shaping the new digital world. In particular, we are applying methods from the following research fields: Case-Based Reasoning Explainable Artificial Intelligence Decision Support Systems Information Extraction and Knowledge Engineering Research Unit: Data and Artificial Intelligence Current Projects: TrustLLM - Democratising trustworthy and factual large language model technology for Europe (2023-2026, Funding: EU HEU) LABDA - Learning Network for Advanced Behavioural Data Analysis (2023-2027, Funding: EU MSCA) Digi-FrailCare: A sustainable multidisciplinary model for personalized care for frail older people, using artificial intelligence and the next generation of medical records (2023-2027, Funding NTNU Helse) AI-MENT - Machine learning to tailor treatments in mental health (2023-2027, Funding NTNU Helse) SmaRTWork - a digital system for personalized return-to-work recommendations for sick-listed with musculoskeletal disorders (2021 - 2027, Funding: Research Council of Norway) Physical activity behavior and sleep study (2020-2025, Funding NTNU Helse) SupportPrim - Using AI for treatment planning of musculoskeletal pain (2020-2024, Funding: Research Council of Norway) Exaigon - Explainable AI systems for gradual industry adoption (2020 - 2024, Funding: Research Council of Norway) Completed Projects: AI4EU - An AI-on-demand platform for Europe (partner, Funding: EU H2020, 2019 – 2021) selfBACK - A decision support system for self-management of low back pain (project manager, Funding: EUH2020, 2016-2021) Back-UP - Personalised Prognostic Models to Improve Well-being and Return to Work After Neck and Low Back Pain (task leader, Funding: EU H2020, 2018 – 2021) Competencies Artificial intelligence Big Data Case-Based Reasoning EHealth & mHealth Explainable AI Information retrieval Knowledge Management Knowledge acquisition Knowledge modelling Machine learning ehealth Publications 2025 Sylvester, Rebecca Sophia; Bach, Kerstin; Kallestad, Håvard.
